Denis Malbec, winemaker at Captûre Wines, dies in Napa County crash
item.description:
Denis Malbec, winemaker at Captûre Wines, dies in Napa County crash

A well-known North Bay winemaker was killed in an early morning crash Saturday in Yountville. Denis Malbec, 46, of St. Helena, was driving a 2016 Mercedes-Benz west on Washington Street at an unknown speed around 1:10 a.m. when it ran off the road near Highway 29, according to the CHP.

item.title: 'Over the hill' fine for Vegas-bound Yountville cyclist
item.description:
'Over the hill' fine for Vegas-bound Yountville cyclist

Drivers heading along Silverado Trail may see an unusual sight: two men appearing to walk at the speed of a bicycle along the shoulder. Bob Redwanc, left, and Dr. Ted Jenal ride ElliptiGos - outdoor elliptical bicycles that require 30 to 35 percent more effort to propel than traditional bicycles, according to Redwanc.

item.title: 3 great Napa wine tasting stops -- plus lunch
item.description:
3 great Napa wine tasting stops -- plus lunch

By Mary Orlin, morlin@bayareanewsgroup.com Posted: 04/14/2016 10:00:00 AM PDT There are more than 500 wineries in the Napa Valley and vintners are opening tasting rooms at a dizzying pace. Wondering where to go swirl, sniff and sip? We scoped out the best of the new places, from bucolic vineyard settings to urban digs, run by owners from unexpected worlds.

item.title: 2013 Kirkland Signature Series Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon - CostcoWineBlog.com
item.description:
2013 Kirkland Signature Series Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon - CostcoWineBlog.com

Here's another Kirkland wine that I've been anxiously awaiting - the 2013 Signature Series Napa Cab. I really enjoyed the 2012 vintage of this wine, which was a fantastic growing year, and 2013 was according to some accounts, almost equally as good.

item.title: Pairing: Rosé, baguette and strawberries
item.description:
Pairing: Rosé, baguette and strawberries

The 2015 vintage of Quivira Dry Creek Valley Rosé, our Wine of the Week, is a stand out and a knock out. It is hard to think of a better dry rosé. The 2014 vintage was excellent, too, but the wines do not mirror each other.

item.title: Cotati baseball fan shares ballpark recipe for Garlic Fries
item.description:
Cotati baseball fan shares ballpark recipe for Garlic Fries

Just like the sweet flavor of Dungeness crab and the tang of sourdough bread, the fragrant allure of the garlic fries served at San Francisco's AT&T Park has become synonymous with the City by the Bay and its beloved baseball team, the Giants.

item.title: Healdsburg, Napa and San Francisco Named Best Food Cities 2016 | Sonoma Wine Country Dining
item.description:
Healdsburg, Napa and San Francisco Named Best Food Cities 2016 | Sonoma Wine Country Dining

I rarely get too excited when random magazines and websites celebrate Sonoma County as a best foodie destination. I mean, duh, we all know that. But its a little more interesting when Conde Nast Traveler readers pin Healdsburg (12), Napa(8) and San Francisco (9) among the 15 Best Food Cities in the U.S.
